clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Rapid Detection of MRSA
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical and Economic Impact of a Rapid Test for Detection of Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus Aureus (MRSA) From Sterile Sites (the Alere™ PBP2a)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the impact of the Alere™ PBP2a test combined with pharmacist review of antimicrobial therapy, on clinical outcomes and cost in hospitalized patients with sterile site S. aureus infection.

clinical_study.why_stopped: personnel change, unable to continue study

primary_outcome.measure: Time (hours) to optimal antimicrobial therapy for patients with MSSA and MRSA infections in the pre-intervention and post-intervention periods
primary_outcome.time_frame: within first 7 days of culture result

secondary_outcome.measure: Time (in hours) to identification of MRSA.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within first 3 days of culture result

secondary_outcome.measure: Vancomycin days of therapy following S. aureus culture result
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the 2 weeks following culture result

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with MSSA infection who are switched from an MRSA-active drug to an MSSA-active drug .
Duration of bacteremia in patients with MSSA or MRSA bloodstream infections
other_outcome.time_frame: within first 30 days of culture result

other_outcome.measure: Time to contact isolation in patients with MRSA infections
other_outcome.time_frame: within first 7 days of culture result
from time of culture result to hospital discharge, an expected average duration of 4 weeks

other_outcome.measure: Total healthcare costs (broken down by bed, laboratory, and pharmacy costs).
other_outcome.time_frame: from time of culture result to time of hospital discharge, an expected average duration of 4 weeks
other_outcome.description: participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay following positive culture result, an expected average of 4 weeks.

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients where a electronic (P-care) rule flagged for discordant therapy for the PBP2a result
other_outcome.time_frame: within first 3 days after culture result

other_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients where the pharmacist contacted the service to modify therapy
other_outcome.time_frame: wihtin first 7 days after culture result

arm_group.description: Patients with growth of S. aureus from sterile site cultures between Sept 15, 2012 - Dec 31, 2012. No rapid testing was performed, and standard bacterial culture and susceptibility testing was done.

Patients with growth of S. aureus from sterile site cultures between Sept 15, 2013 - Dec 31, 2013. Rapid PBP2a testing was performed along with pharmacist notification of service if modification to therapy needed based on rapid test results.

study_pop.textblock: Inpatients (adults and children) at Mayo Clinic, Rochester with sterile source S. aureus cultures between Sept 15, 2012 - Dec 31, 2012 (control) and Sept 15, 2013 - Dec 31, 2013 (intervention)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Inpatients (adults and children) at Mayo Clinic, Rochester with sterile source S. aureus cultures (both control and intervention periods)
2. Above, with rapid PBP2a testing (intervention period only).
Exclusion criteria:
1. Patients with polymicrobial cultures (i.e., growth of S. aureus plus other organisms in the culture).
2. Patients who have not provided MN authorization to use their medical records for research.
3. Patients who have had the FilmArray Blood culture identification diagnostic test performed on an index S. aureus blood culture.
4. Patients who have had a sterile source S. aureus culture within the prior 30 days.
